body.p: On the basis of the feedback received, the IASB concluded that it is not possible to provide one method of measuring the right-of-use asset on transition that would (a) avoid an artificial higher expense related to leases following initial application of IFRS 16; and (b) address the cost concerns of preparers. Consequently, the IASB decided to permit lessees to choose, on a lease-by-lease basis, how to measure the right-of-use asset on transition to IFRS 16. Paragraph C8(b) permits a lessee either to measure the right-of-use asset as if IFRS 16 had always been applied or to measure the right-of-use asset at an amount equal to the lease liability (adjusted by the amount of any previously recognised prepaid or accrued lease payments).
